title: Schema for an Open Contracting Release

_88Transaction.description: A spending transaction related to the contracting process. Draws upon the data models of the [Fiscal Data Package](http://fiscal.dataprotocols.org/) and the [International Aid Transpareny Initiative](http://iatistandard.org/activity-standard/iati-activities/iati-activity/transaction/) and should be used to cross-reference to more detailed information held using a Budget Data Package, IATI file, or to provide enough information to allow a user to manually or automatically cross-reference with some other published source of transactional spending data.
_88Transaction.title: Transaction information

___scheme.description: Organization identifiers be drawn from an existing identification scheme. This field is used to indicate the scheme or codelist in which the identifier will be found. This value should be drawn from the [Organization Identifier Scheme](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/codelists/#organization-identifier-scheme).
___scheme.title: Scheme

___uri.description: A URI to identify the organization, such as those provided by [Open Corporates](http://www.opencorporates.com) or some other relevant URI provider. This is not for listing the website of the organization: that can be done through the url field of the Organization contact point.
___uri.title: URI

___legalName.description: The legally registered name of the organization.
___legalName.title: Legal Name

___id.description: The identifier of the organization in the selected scheme.
___id.title: ID

___receiverOrganization.description: The Organization Identifier for the organization which receives the funds in this transaction. Expressed following the Organizational Identifier standard - consult the documentation and the codelist.
___receiverOrganization.title: Receiver organization

___uri.description: A URI pointing directly to a machine-readable record about this spending transaction.
___uri.title: Linked spending information

___scheme.description: Organization identifiers be drawn from an existing identification scheme. This field is used to indicate the scheme or codelist in which the identifier will be found. This value should be drawn from the [Organization Identifier Scheme](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/codelists/#organization-identifier-scheme).
___scheme.title: Scheme

___uri.description: A URI to identify the organization, such as those provided by [Open Corporates](http://www.opencorporates.com) or some other relevant URI provider. This is not for listing the website of the organization: that can be done through the url field of the Organization contact point.
___uri.title: URI

___legalName.description: The legally registered name of the organization.
___legalName.title: Legal Name

___id.description: The identifier of the organization in the selected scheme.
___id.title: ID

___providerOrganization.description: The Organization Identifier for the organization from which the funds in this transaction originate. Expressed following the Organizational Identifier standard - consult the documentation and the codelist.
___providerOrganization.title: Provider organization

___id.description: A unique identifier for this transaction. This identifier should be possible to cross-reference against the provided data source. For the budget data package this is the id, for IATI, the transaction reference.
___id.title: ID

___source.description: Used to point either to a corresponding Budget Data Package, IATI file, or machine or human-readable source where users can find further information on the budget line item identifiers, or project identifiers, provided here.
___source.title: Data source

_88Document.description: Links to, or descriptions of, external documents can be attached at various locations within the standard. Documents may be supporting information, formal notices, downloadable forms, or any other kind of resource that should be made public as part of full open contracting.
_88Document.title: Document

___language.description: Specifies the language of the linked document using either two-digit [ISO 639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes), or extended [BCP47 language tags](http://www.w3.org/International/articles/language-tags/). The use of two-letter codes from [ISO 639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes) is strongly recommended unless there is a clear user need for distinguishing the language subtype.
___language.title: Language

___dateModified.description: Date that the document was last modified
___dateModified.title: Date modified

___format.description: The format of the document taken from the [IANA Media Types code list](http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/), with the addition of one extra value for 'offline/print', used when this document entry is being used to describe the offline publication of a document. Use values from the template column. Links to web pages should be tagged 'text/html'.
___format.title: Format

___description.description: A short description of the document. We recommend descriptions do not exceed 250 words. In the event the document is not accessible online, the description field can be used to describe arrangements for obtaining a copy of the document.
___description.title: Description

___url.description: direct link to the document or attachment. The server providing access to this document should be configured to correctly report the document mime type.
___url.title: URL

___datePublished.description: The date on which the document was first published. This is particularly important for legally important documents such as notices of a tender.
___datePublished.title: Date published

___id.description: A local, unique identifier for this document. This field is used to keep track of multiple revisions of a document through the compilation from release to record mechanism.
___id.title: ID

___documentType.description: A classification of the document described taken from the [documentType codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/codelists/#document-type). Values from the provided codelist should be used wherever possible, though extended values can be provided if the codelist does not have a relevant code.
___documentType.title: Document type

_88Item.description: A good, service, or work to be contracted.
_88Item.title: Item

___description.description: A description of the goods, services to be provided.
___description.title: Description

___additionalClassifications.description: An array of additional classifications for the item. See the [itemClassificationScheme](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/codelists/#item-classification-scheme) codelist for common options to use in OCDS. This may also be used to present codes from an internal classification scheme.
___additionalClassifications.title: Additional classifications

___scheme.description: An classification should be drawn from an existing scheme or list of codes. This field is used to indicate the scheme/codelist from which the classification is drawn. For line item classifications, this value should represent an known [Item Classification Scheme](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/codelists/#item-classification-scheme) wherever possible.
___scheme.title: Scheme

___description.description: A textual description or title for the code.
___description.title: Description

___uri.description: A URI to identify the code. In the event individual URIs are not available for items in the identifier scheme this value should be left blank.
___uri.title: URI

___id.description: The classification code drawn from the selected scheme.
___id.title: ID

___scheme.description: An classification should be drawn from an existing scheme or list of codes. This field is used to indicate the scheme/codelist from which the classification is drawn. For line item classifications, this value should represent an known [Item Classification Scheme](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/codelists/#item-classification-scheme) wherever possible.
___scheme.title: Scheme

___description.description: A textual description or title for the code.
___description.title: Description

___uri.description: A URI to identify the code. In the event individual URIs are not available for items in the identifier scheme this value should be left blank.
___uri.title: URI

___id.description: The classification code drawn from the selected scheme.
___id.title: ID

___classification.description: The primary classification for the item. See the [itemClassificationScheme](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/codelists/#item-classification-scheme) to identify preferred classification lists, including CPV and GSIN.
___classification.title: Classification

___id.description: A local identifier to reference and merge the items by. Must be unique within a given array of items.
___id.title: ID

___unit.description: Description of the unit which the good comes in e.g. hours, kilograms. Made up of a unit name, and the value of a single unit.
___unit.title: Unit

___value.description: The monetary value of a single unit.
___value.title: Value

_88Budget.description: This section contain information about the budget line, and associated projects, through which this contracting process is funded. It draws upon data model of the [Fiscal Data Package](http://fiscal.dataprotocols.org/), and should be used to cross-reference to more detailed information held using a Budget Data Package, or, where no linked Budget Data Package is available, to provide enough information to allow a user to manually or automatically cross-reference with another published source of budget and project information.
_88Budget.title: Budget information

___projectID.description: An external identifier for the project that this contracting process forms part of, or is funded via (if applicable). Some organizations maintain a registry of projects, and the data should use the identifier from the relevant registry of projects.
___projectID.title: Project identifier

___description.description: A short free text description of the budget source. May be used to provide the title of the budget line, or the programme used to fund this project.
___description.title: Budget Source

___amount.description: The value of the budget line item.
___amount.title: Amount

___uri.description: A URI pointing directly to a machine-readable record about the related budget or projects for this contracting process.
___uri.title: Linked budget information

___project.description: The name of the project that through which this contracting process is funded (if applicable). Some organizations maintain a registry of projects, and the data should use the name by which the project is known in that registry. No translation option is offered for this string, as translated values can be provided in third-party data, linked from the data source above.
___project.title: Project title

___id.description: An identifier for the budget line item which provides funds for this contracting process. This identifier should be possible to cross-reference against the provided data source.
___id.title: ID

___source.description: Used to point either to a corresponding Budget Data Package, or to a machine or human-readable source where users can find further information on the budget line item identifiers, or project identifiers, provided here.
___source.title: Data Source

_88Contract.description: Information regarding the signed contract between the buyer and supplier(s).
_88Contract.title: Contract

___documents.description: All documents and attachments related to the contract, including any notices.
___documents.title: Documents

$eref.description: Links to, or descriptions of, external documents can be attached at various locations within the standard. Documents may be supporting information, formal notices, downloadable forms, or any other kind of resource that should be made public as part of full open contracting.
$eref.title: Document

___language.description: Specifies the language of the linked document using either two-digit [ISO 639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes), or extended [BCP47 language tags](http://www.w3.org/International/articles/language-tags/). The use of two-letter codes from [ISO 639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes) is strongly recommended unless there is a clear user need for distinguishing the language subtype.
___language.title: Language

___dateModified.description: Date that the document was last modified
___dateModified.title: Date modified

___format.description: The format of the document taken from the [IANA Media Types code list](http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/), with the addition of one extra value for 'offline/print', used when this document entry is being used to describe the offline publication of a document. Use values from the template column. Links to web pages should be tagged 'text/html'.
___format.title: Format

___description.description: A short description of the document. We recommend descriptions do not exceed 250 words. In the event the document is not accessible online, the description field can be used to describe arrangements for obtaining a copy of the document.
___description.title: Description

___url.description: direct link to the document or attachment. The server providing access to this document should be configured to correctly report the document mime type.
___url.title: URL

___datePublished.description: The date on which the document was first published. This is particularly important for legally important documents such as notices of a tender.
___datePublished.title: Date published

___id.description: A local, unique identifier for this document. This field is used to keep track of multiple revisions of a document through the compilation from release to record mechanism.
___id.title: ID

___documentType.description: A classification of the document described taken from the [documentType codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/codelists/#document-type). Values from the provided codelist should be used wherever possible, though extended values can be provided if the codelist does not have a relevant code.
___documentType.title: Document type

___description.description: Contract description
___description.title: Contract description

___status.description: The current status of the contract. Drawn from the [contractStatus codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/codelists/#contract-status)
___status.title: Contract status

___changes.description: An array change objects describing the fields changed, and their former values.
___changes.title: Amended fields

___property.description: The property name that has been changed relative to the place the amendment is. For example if the contract value has changed, then the property under changes within the contract.amendment would be value.amount.
___property.title: Property

___former_value.description: The previous value of the changed property, in whatever type the property is.
___former_value.title: Former Value

___awardID.description: The award.id against which this contract is being issued.
___awardID.title: Award ID

___items.description: The goods, services, and any intangible outcomes in this contract. Note: If the items are the same as the award do not repeat.
___items.title: Items contracted

$eref.description: A good, service, or work to be contracted.
$eref.title: Item

___description.description: A description of the goods, services to be provided.
___description.title: Description

___additionalClassifications.description: An array of additional classifications for the item. See the [itemClassificationScheme](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/codelists/#item-classification-scheme) codelist for common options to use in OCDS. This may also be used to present codes from an internal classification scheme.
___additionalClassifications.title: Additional classifications

___classification.description: The primary classification for the item. See the [itemClassificationScheme](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/codelists/#item-classification-scheme) to identify preferred classification lists, including CPV and GSIN.
___classification.title: Classification

___id.description: A local identifier to reference and merge the items by. Must be unique within a given array of items.
___id.title: ID

___unit.description: Description of the unit which the good comes in e.g. hours, kilograms. Made up of a unit name, and the value of a single unit.
___unit.title: Unit

___value.description: The monetary value of a single unit.
___value.title: Value

___startDate.description: The start date for the period.
___startDate.title: Start date

___endDate.description: The end date for the period.
___endDate.title: End date

___period.description: The start and end date for the contract.
___period.title: Period

___dateSigned.description: The date the contract was signed. In the case of multiple signatures, the date of the last signature.
___dateSigned.title: Date signed

___value.description: The total value of this contract.
___value.title: Value

$eref.description: Information during the performance / implementation stage of the contract.
$eref.title: Implementation

___documents.description: Documents and reports that are part of the implementation phase e.g. audit and evaluation reports.
___documents.title: Documents

___transactions.description: A list of the spending transactions made against this contract
___transactions.title: Transactions

___milestones.description: As milestones are completed, milestone completions should be documented.
___milestones.title: Milestones

___implementation.description: Information related to the implementation of the contract in accordance with the obligations laid out therein.
___implementation.title: Implementation

___id.description: The identifier for this contract. It must be unique and cannot change within its Open Contracting Process (defined by a single ocid). See the [identifier guidance](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/identifiers/) for further details.
___id.title: Contract ID

___scheme.description: An classification should be drawn from an existing scheme or list of codes. This field is used to indicate the scheme/codelist from which the classification is drawn. For line item classifications, this value should represent an known [Item Classification Scheme](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/codelists/#item-classification-scheme) wherever possible.
___scheme.title: Scheme

___description.description: A textual description or title for the code.
___description.title: Description

___uri.description: A URI to identify the code. In the event individual URIs are not available for items in the identifier scheme this value should be left blank.
___uri.title: URI

___id.description: The classification code drawn from the selected scheme.
___id.title: ID

___documents.description: List of documents associated with this milestone.
___documents.title: Documents

$eref.description: Links to, or descriptions of, external documents can be attached at various locations within the standard. Documents may be supporting information, formal notices, downloadable forms, or any other kind of resource that should be made public as part of full open contracting.
$eref.title: Document

___language.description: Specifies the language of the linked document using either two-digit [ISO 639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes), or extended [BCP47 language tags](http://www.w3.org/International/articles/language-tags/). The use of two-letter codes from [ISO 639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes) is strongly recommended unless there is a clear user need for distinguishing the language subtype.
___language.title: Language

___dateModified.description: Date that the document was last modified
___dateModified.title: Date modified

___format.description: The format of the document taken from the [IANA Media Types code list](http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/), with the addition of one extra value for 'offline/print', used when this document entry is being used to describe the offline publication of a document. Use values from the template column. Links to web pages should be tagged 'text/html'.
___format.title: Format

___description.description: A short description of the document. We recommend descriptions do not exceed 250 words. In the event the document is not accessible online, the description field can be used to describe arrangements for obtaining a copy of the document.
___description.title: Description

___url.description: direct link to the document or attachment. The server providing access to this document should be configured to correctly report the document mime type.
___url.title: URL

___datePublished.description: The date on which the document was first published. This is particularly important for legally important documents such as notices of a tender.
___datePublished.title: Date published

___id.description: A local, unique identifier for this document. This field is used to keep track of multiple revisions of a document through the compilation from release to record mechanism.
___id.title: ID

___documentType.description: A classification of the document described taken from the [documentType codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/codelists/#document-type). Values from the provided codelist should be used wherever possible, though extended values can be provided if the codelist does not have a relevant code.
___documentType.title: Document type

___dateModified.description: The date the milestone was last reviewed or modified and the status was altered or confirmed to still be correct.
___dateModified.title: Date modified

___description.description: A description of the milestone.
___description.title: Description

___status.description: The status that was realized on the date provided in dateModified, drawn from the [milestoneStatus codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/codelists/#milestone-status).
___status.title: Status

___dueDate.description: The date the milestone is due.
___dueDate.title: Due date

___id.description: A local identifier for this milestone, unique within this block. This field is used to keep track of multiple revisions of a milestone through the compilation from release to record mechanism.
___id.title: ID

___startDate.description: The start date for the period.
___startDate.title: Start date

___endDate.description: The end date for the period.
___endDate.title: End date

___changes.description: An array change objects describing the fields changed, and their former values.
___changes.title: Amended fields

___property.description: The property name that has been changed relative to the place the amendment is. For example if the contract value has changed, then the property under changes within the contract.amendment would be value.amount.
___property.title: Property

___former_value.description: The previous value of the changed property, in whatever type the property is.
___former_value.title: Former Value

_88Tender.description: Data regarding tender process - publicly inviting prospective contractors to submit bids for evaluation and selecting a winner or winners.
_88Tender.title: Tender

___status.description: The current status of the tender based on the [tenderStatus codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/codelists/#tender-status)
___status.title: Tender status

___submissionMethod.description: Specify the method by which bids must be submitted, in person, written, or electronic auction. Using the [submission method codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/codelists/#submission-method)
___submissionMethod.title: Submission method

___procurementMethod.description: Specify tendering method against the [method codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/codelists/#method) as per [GPA definitions](http://www.wto.org/english/docs_e/legal_e/rev-gpr-94_01_e.htm) of Open, Selective, Limited
___procurementMethod.title: Procurement method

___hasEnquiries.description: A Yes/No field to indicate whether enquiries were part of tender process.
___hasEnquiries.title: Has enquiries?

___tenderers.description: All entities who submit a tender.
___tenderers.title: Tenderers

$eref.description: An organization.
$eref.title: Organization

___name.description: The common name of the organization. The ID property provides an space for the formal legal name, and so this may either repeat that value, or could provide the common name by which this organization is known. This field could also include details of the department or sub-unit involved in this contracting process.
___name.title: Common name

___additionalIdentifiers.description: A list of additional / supplemental identifiers for the organization, using the [organization identifier guidance](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/identifiers/). This could be used to provide an internally used identifier for this organization in addition to the primary legal entity identifier.
___additionalIdentifiers.title: Additional identifiers

___identifier.description: The primary identifier for this organization. Identifiers that uniquely pick out a legal entity should be preferred. Consult the [organization identifier guidance](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/identifiers/) for the preferred scheme and identifier to use.
___identifier.title: Primary identifier

___awardCriteriaDetails.description: Any detailed or further information on the award or selection criteria.
___awardCriteriaDetails.title: Award criteria details

___startDate.description: The start date for the period.
___startDate.title: Start date

___endDate.description: The end date for the period.
___endDate.title: End date

___awardPeriod.description: The date or period on which an award is anticipated to be made.
___awardPeriod.title: Award period

___minValue.description: The minimum estimated value of the procurement.
___minValue.title: Minimum value

___documents.description: All documents and attachments related to the tender, including any notices. See the [documentType codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/codelists/#document-type) for details of potential documents to include.
___documents.title: Documents

$eref.description: Links to, or descriptions of, external documents can be attached at various locations within the standard. Documents may be supporting information, formal notices, downloadable forms, or any other kind of resource that should be made public as part of full open contracting.
$eref.title: Document

___language.description: Specifies the language of the linked document using either two-digit [ISO 639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes), or extended [BCP47 language tags](http://www.w3.org/International/articles/language-tags/). The use of two-letter codes from [ISO 639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes) is strongly recommended unless there is a clear user need for distinguishing the language subtype.
___language.title: Language

___dateModified.description: Date that the document was last modified
___dateModified.title: Date modified

___format.description: The format of the document taken from the [IANA Media Types code list](http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/), with the addition of one extra value for 'offline/print', used when this document entry is being used to describe the offline publication of a document. Use values from the template column. Links to web pages should be tagged 'text/html'.
___format.title: Format

___description.description: A short description of the document. We recommend descriptions do not exceed 250 words. In the event the document is not accessible online, the description field can be used to describe arrangements for obtaining a copy of the document.
___description.title: Description

___url.description: direct link to the document or attachment. The server providing access to this document should be configured to correctly report the document mime type.
___url.title: URL

___datePublished.description: The date on which the document was first published. This is particularly important for legally important documents such as notices of a tender.
___datePublished.title: Date published

___id.description: A local, unique identifier for this document. This field is used to keep track of multiple revisions of a document through the compilation from release to record mechanism.
___id.title: ID

___documentType.description: A classification of the document described taken from the [documentType codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/codelists/#document-type). Values from the provided codelist should be used wherever possible, though extended values can be provided if the codelist does not have a relevant code.
___documentType.title: Document type

___startDate.description: The start date for the period.
___startDate.title: Start date

___endDate.description: The end date for the period.
___endDate.title: End date

___enquiryPeriod.description: The period during which enquiries may be made and answered.
___enquiryPeriod.title: Enquiry period

___description.description: Tender description
___description.title: Tender description

___procurementMethodDetails.description: Additional detail on the procurement method used. This field may be used to provide the local name of the particular procurement method used.
___procurementMethodDetails.title: Procurement method details

___value.description: The total upper estimated value of the procurement.
___value.title: Value

___awardCriteria.description: Specify the award criteria for the procurement, using the [award criteria codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/codelists/#award-criteria)
___awardCriteria.title: Award criteria

___eligibilityCriteria.description: A description of any eligibility criteria for potential suppliers.
___eligibilityCriteria.title: Eligibility criteria

___milestones.description: A list of milestones associated with the tender.
___milestones.title: Milestones

___documents.description: List of documents associated with this milestone.
___documents.title: Documents

___dateModified.description: The date the milestone was last reviewed or modified and the status was altered or confirmed to still be correct.
___dateModified.title: Date modified

___description.description: A description of the milestone.
___description.title: Description

___status.description: The status that was realized on the date provided in dateModified, drawn from the [milestoneStatus codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/codelists/#milestone-status).
___status.title: Status

___dueDate.description: The date the milestone is due.
___dueDate.title: Due date

___id.description: A local identifier for this milestone, unique within this block. This field is used to keep track of multiple revisions of a milestone through the compilation from release to record mechanism.
___id.title: ID

___procurementMethodRationale.description: Rationale of procurement method, especially in the case of Limited tendering.
___procurementMethodRationale.title: Procurement method rationale

___startDate.description: The start date for the period.
___startDate.title: Start date

___endDate.description: The end date for the period.
___endDate.title: End date

___tenderPeriod.description: The period when the tender is open for submissions. The end date is the closing date for tender submissions.
___tenderPeriod.title: Tender period

___changes.description: An array change objects describing the fields changed, and their former values.
___changes.title: Amended fields

___property.description: The property name that has been changed relative to the place the amendment is. For example if the contract value has changed, then the property under changes within the contract.amendment would be value.amount.
___property.title: Property

___former_value.description: The previous value of the changed property, in whatever type the property is.
___former_value.title: Former Value

$eref.description: An organization.
$eref.title: Organization

___name.description: The common name of the organization. The ID property provides an space for the formal legal name, and so this may either repeat that value, or could provide the common name by which this organization is known. This field could also include details of the department or sub-unit involved in this contracting process.
___name.title: Common name

___additionalIdentifiers.description: A list of additional / supplemental identifiers for the organization, using the [organization identifier guidance](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/identifiers/). This could be used to provide an internally used identifier for this organization in addition to the primary legal entity identifier.
___additionalIdentifiers.title: Additional identifiers

___identifier.description: The primary identifier for this organization. Identifiers that uniquely pick out a legal entity should be preferred. Consult the [organization identifier guidance](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/identifiers/) for the preferred scheme and identifier to use.
___identifier.title: Primary identifier

___procuringEntity.description: The entity managing the procurement, which may be different from the buyer who is paying / using the items being procured.
___procuringEntity.title: Procuring entity

___items.description: The goods and services to be purchased, broken into line items wherever possible. Items should not be duplicated, but a quantity of 2 specified instead.
___items.title: Items to be procured

$eref.description: A good, service, or work to be contracted.
$eref.title: Item

___description.description: A description of the goods, services to be provided.
___description.title: Description

___additionalClassifications.description: An array of additional classifications for the item. See the [itemClassificationScheme](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/codelists/#item-classification-scheme) codelist for common options to use in OCDS. This may also be used to present codes from an internal classification scheme.
___additionalClassifications.title: Additional classifications

___classification.description: The primary classification for the item. See the [itemClassificationScheme](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/codelists/#item-classification-scheme) to identify preferred classification lists, including CPV and GSIN.
___classification.title: Classification

___id.description: A local identifier to reference and merge the items by. Must be unique within a given array of items.
___id.title: ID

___unit.description: Description of the unit which the good comes in e.g. hours, kilograms. Made up of a unit name, and the value of a single unit.
___unit.title: Unit

___value.description: The monetary value of a single unit.
___value.title: Value

___id.description: An identifier for this tender process. This may be the same as the ocid, or may be drawn from an internally held identifier for this tender.
___id.title: Tender ID

___numberOfTenderers.description: The number of entities who submit a tender.
___numberOfTenderers.title: Number of tenderers

___submissionMethodDetails.description: Any detailed or further information on the submission method. This may include the address, e-mail address or online service to which bids should be submitted, and any special requirements to be followed for submissions.
___submissionMethodDetails.title: Submission method details

_88Planning.description: Information from the planning phase of the contracting process. Note that many other fields may be filled in a planning release, in the appropriate fields in other schema sections, these would likely be estimates at this stage e.g. totalValue in tender
_88Planning.title: Planning

___documents.description: A list of documents related to the planning process.
___documents.title: Documents

$eref.description: Links to, or descriptions of, external documents can be attached at various locations within the standard. Documents may be supporting information, formal notices, downloadable forms, or any other kind of resource that should be made public as part of full open contracting.
$eref.title: Document

___language.description: Specifies the language of the linked document using either two-digit [ISO 639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes), or extended [BCP47 language tags](http://www.w3.org/International/articles/language-tags/). The use of two-letter codes from [ISO 639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes) is strongly recommended unless there is a clear user need for distinguishing the language subtype.
___language.title: Language

___dateModified.description: Date that the document was last modified
___dateModified.title: Date modified

___format.description: The format of the document taken from the [IANA Media Types code list](http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/), with the addition of one extra value for 'offline/print', used when this document entry is being used to describe the offline publication of a document. Use values from the template column. Links to web pages should be tagged 'text/html'.
___format.title: Format

___description.description: A short description of the document. We recommend descriptions do not exceed 250 words. In the event the document is not accessible online, the description field can be used to describe arrangements for obtaining a copy of the document.
___description.title: Description

___url.description: direct link to the document or attachment. The server providing access to this document should be configured to correctly report the document mime type.
___url.title: URL

___datePublished.description: The date on which the document was first published. This is particularly important for legally important documents such as notices of a tender.
___datePublished.title: Date published

___id.description: A local, unique identifier for this document. This field is used to keep track of multiple revisions of a document through the compilation from release to record mechanism.
___id.title: ID

___documentType.description: A classification of the document described taken from the [documentType codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/codelists/#document-type). Values from the provided codelist should be used wherever possible, though extended values can be provided if the codelist does not have a relevant code.
___documentType.title: Document type

$eref.description: This section contain information about the budget line, and associated projects, through which this contracting process is funded. It draws upon data model of the [Fiscal Data Package](http://fiscal.dataprotocols.org/), and should be used to cross-reference to more detailed information held using a Budget Data Package, or, where no linked Budget Data Package is available, to provide enough information to allow a user to manually or automatically cross-reference with another published source of budget and project information.
$eref.title: Budget information

___projectID.description: An external identifier for the project that this contracting process forms part of, or is funded via (if applicable). Some organizations maintain a registry of projects, and the data should use the identifier from the relevant registry of projects.
___projectID.title: Project identifier

___description.description: A short free text description of the budget source. May be used to provide the title of the budget line, or the programme used to fund this project.
___description.title: Budget Source

___amount.description: The value of the budget line item.
___amount.title: Amount

___uri.description: A URI pointing directly to a machine-readable record about the related budget or projects for this contracting process.
___uri.title: Linked budget information

___project.description: The name of the project that through which this contracting process is funded (if applicable). Some organizations maintain a registry of projects, and the data should use the name by which the project is known in that registry. No translation option is offered for this string, as translated values can be provided in third-party data, linked from the data source above.
___project.title: Project title

___id.description: An identifier for the budget line item which provides funds for this contracting process. This identifier should be possible to cross-reference against the provided data source.
___id.title: ID

___source.description: Used to point either to a corresponding Budget Data Package, or to a machine or human-readable source where users can find further information on the budget line item identifiers, or project identifiers, provided here.
___source.title: Data Source

___rationale.description: The rationale for the procurement provided in free text. More detail can be provided in an attached document.
___rationale.title: Rationale

_88ContactPoint.description: An person, contact point or department to contact in relation to this contracting process.
_88ContactPoint.title: Contact point

___name.description: The name of the contact person, department, or contact point, for correspondence relating to this contracting process.
___name.title: Name

___email.description: The e-mail address of the contact point/person.
___email.title: Email

___url.description: A web address for the contact point/person.
___url.title: URL

___faxNumber.description: The fax number of the contact point/person. This should include the international dialling code.
___faxNumber.title: Fax number

___telephone.description: The telephone number of the contact point/person. This should include the international dialling code.
___telephone.title: Telephone

___scheme.description: Organization identifiers be drawn from an existing identification scheme. This field is used to indicate the scheme or codelist in which the identifier will be found. This value should be drawn from the [Organization Identifier Scheme](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/codelists/#organization-identifier-scheme).
___scheme.title: Scheme

___uri.description: A URI to identify the organization, such as those provided by [Open Corporates](http://www.opencorporates.com) or some other relevant URI provider. This is not for listing the website of the organization: that can be done through the url field of the Organization contact point.
___uri.title: URI

___legalName.description: The legally registered name of the organization.
___legalName.title: Legal Name

___id.description: The identifier of the organization in the selected scheme.
___id.title: ID

___name.description: The common name of the organization. The ID property provides an space for the formal legal name, and so this may either repeat that value, or could provide the common name by which this organization is known. This field could also include details of the department or sub-unit involved in this contracting process.
___name.title: Common name

$eref.description: An person, contact point or department to contact in relation to this contracting process.
$eref.title: Contact point

___name.description: The name of the contact person, department, or contact point, for correspondence relating to this contracting process.
___name.title: Name

___email.description: The e-mail address of the contact point/person.
___email.title: Email

___url.description: A web address for the contact point/person.
___url.title: URL

___faxNumber.description: The fax number of the contact point/person. This should include the international dialling code.
___faxNumber.title: Fax number

___telephone.description: The telephone number of the contact point/person. This should include the international dialling code.
___telephone.title: Telephone

___additionalIdentifiers.description: A list of additional / supplemental identifiers for the organization, using the [organization identifier guidance](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/identifiers/). This could be used to provide an internally used identifier for this organization in addition to the primary legal entity identifier.
___additionalIdentifiers.title: Additional identifiers

___scheme.description: Organization identifiers be drawn from an existing identification scheme. This field is used to indicate the scheme or codelist in which the identifier will be found. This value should be drawn from the [Organization Identifier Scheme](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/codelists/#organization-identifier-scheme).
___scheme.title: Scheme

___uri.description: A URI to identify the organization, such as those provided by [Open Corporates](http://www.opencorporates.com) or some other relevant URI provider. This is not for listing the website of the organization: that can be done through the url field of the Organization contact point.
___uri.title: URI

___legalName.description: The legally registered name of the organization.
___legalName.title: Legal Name

___id.description: The identifier of the organization in the selected scheme.
___id.title: ID

$eref.description: An address. This may be the legally registered address of the organization, or may be a correspondence address for this particular contracting process.
$eref.title: Address

___streetAddress.description: The street address. For example, 1600 Amphitheatre Pkwy.
___streetAddress.title: Street address

___locality.description: The locality. For example, Mountain View.
___locality.title: Locality

___countryName.description: The country name. For example, United States.
___countryName.title: Country name

___scheme.description: Organization identifiers be drawn from an existing identification scheme. This field is used to indicate the scheme or codelist in which the identifier will be found. This value should be drawn from the [Organization Identifier Scheme](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/codelists/#organization-identifier-scheme).
___scheme.title: Scheme

___uri.description: A URI to identify the organization, such as those provided by [Open Corporates](http://www.opencorporates.com) or some other relevant URI provider. This is not for listing the website of the organization: that can be done through the url field of the Organization contact point.
___uri.title: URI

___legalName.description: The legally registered name of the organization.
___legalName.title: Legal Name

___id.description: The identifier of the organization in the selected scheme.
___id.title: ID

___identifier.description: The primary identifier for this organization. Identifiers that uniquely pick out a legal entity should be preferred. Consult the [organization identifier guidance](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/identifiers/) for the preferred scheme and identifier to use.
___identifier.title: Primary identifier

_88Award.description: An award for the given procurement. There may be more than one award per contracting process e.g. because the contract is split amongst different providers, or because it is a standing offer.
_88Award.title: Award

___documents.description: All documents and attachments related to the award, including any notices.
___documents.title: Documents

$eref.description: Links to, or descriptions of, external documents can be attached at various locations within the standard. Documents may be supporting information, formal notices, downloadable forms, or any other kind of resource that should be made public as part of full open contracting.
$eref.title: Document

___language.description: Specifies the language of the linked document using either two-digit [ISO 639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes), or extended [BCP47 language tags](http://www.w3.org/International/articles/language-tags/). The use of two-letter codes from [ISO 639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes) is strongly recommended unless there is a clear user need for distinguishing the language subtype.
___language.title: Language

___dateModified.description: Date that the document was last modified
___dateModified.title: Date modified

___format.description: The format of the document taken from the [IANA Media Types code list](http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/), with the addition of one extra value for 'offline/print', used when this document entry is being used to describe the offline publication of a document. Use values from the template column. Links to web pages should be tagged 'text/html'.
___format.title: Format

___description.description: A short description of the document. We recommend descriptions do not exceed 250 words. In the event the document is not accessible online, the description field can be used to describe arrangements for obtaining a copy of the document.
___description.title: Description

___url.description: direct link to the document or attachment. The server providing access to this document should be configured to correctly report the document mime type.
___url.title: URL

___datePublished.description: The date on which the document was first published. This is particularly important for legally important documents such as notices of a tender.
___datePublished.title: Date published

___id.description: A local, unique identifier for this document. This field is used to keep track of multiple revisions of a document through the compilation from release to record mechanism.
___id.title: ID

___documentType.description: A classification of the document described taken from the [documentType codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/codelists/#document-type). Values from the provided codelist should be used wherever possible, though extended values can be provided if the codelist does not have a relevant code.
___documentType.title: Document type

___description.description: Award description
___description.title: Description

___status.description: The current status of the award drawn from the [awardStatus codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/codelists/#award-status)
___status.title: Award status

___changes.description: An array change objects describing the fields changed, and their former values.
___changes.title: Amended fields

___property.description: The property name that has been changed relative to the place the amendment is. For example if the contract value has changed, then the property under changes within the contract.amendment would be value.amount.
___property.title: Property

___former_value.description: The previous value of the changed property, in whatever type the property is.
___former_value.title: Former Value

___suppliers.description: The suppliers awarded this award. If different suppliers have been awarded different items of values, these should be split into separate award blocks.
___suppliers.title: Suppliers

$eref.description: An organization.
$eref.title: Organization

___name.description: The common name of the organization. The ID property provides an space for the formal legal name, and so this may either repeat that value, or could provide the common name by which this organization is known. This field could also include details of the department or sub-unit involved in this contracting process.
___name.title: Common name

___additionalIdentifiers.description: A list of additional / supplemental identifiers for the organization, using the [organization identifier guidance](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/identifiers/). This could be used to provide an internally used identifier for this organization in addition to the primary legal entity identifier.
___additionalIdentifiers.title: Additional identifiers

___identifier.description: The primary identifier for this organization. Identifiers that uniquely pick out a legal entity should be preferred. Consult the [organization identifier guidance](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/identifiers/) for the preferred scheme and identifier to use.
___identifier.title: Primary identifier

___startDate.description: The start date for the period.
___startDate.title: Start date

___endDate.description: The end date for the period.
___endDate.title: End date

___contractPeriod.description: The period for which the contract has been awarded.
___contractPeriod.title: Contract period

___items.description: The goods and services awarded in this award, broken into line items wherever possible. Items should not be duplicated, but the quantity specified instead.
___items.title: Items awarded

$eref.description: A good, service, or work to be contracted.
$eref.title: Item

___description.description: A description of the goods, services to be provided.
___description.title: Description

___additionalClassifications.description: An array of additional classifications for the item. See the [itemClassificationScheme](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/codelists/#item-classification-scheme) codelist for common options to use in OCDS. This may also be used to present codes from an internal classification scheme.
___additionalClassifications.title: Additional classifications

___classification.description: The primary classification for the item. See the [itemClassificationScheme](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/codelists/#item-classification-scheme) to identify preferred classification lists, including CPV and GSIN.
___classification.title: Classification

___id.description: A local identifier to reference and merge the items by. Must be unique within a given array of items.
___id.title: ID

___unit.description: Description of the unit which the good comes in e.g. hours, kilograms. Made up of a unit name, and the value of a single unit.
___unit.title: Unit

___value.description: The monetary value of a single unit.
___value.title: Value

___value.description: The total value of this award. In the case of a framework contract this may be the total estimated lifetime value, or maximum value, of the agreement. There may be more than one award per procurement.
___value.title: Value

___date.description: The date of the contract award. This is usually the date on which a decision to award was made.
___date.title: Award date

___id.description: The identifier for this award. It must be unique and cannot change within the Open Contracting Process it is part of (defined by a single ocid). See the [identifier guidance](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/identifiers/) for further details.
___id.title: Award ID

_88Implementation.description: Information during the performance / implementation stage of the contract.
_88Implementation.title: Implementation

___documents.description: Documents and reports that are part of the implementation phase e.g. audit and evaluation reports.
___documents.title: Documents

$eref.description: Links to, or descriptions of, external documents can be attached at various locations within the standard. Documents may be supporting information, formal notices, downloadable forms, or any other kind of resource that should be made public as part of full open contracting.
$eref.title: Document

___language.description: Specifies the language of the linked document using either two-digit [ISO 639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes), or extended [BCP47 language tags](http://www.w3.org/International/articles/language-tags/). The use of two-letter codes from [ISO 639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes) is strongly recommended unless there is a clear user need for distinguishing the language subtype.
___language.title: Language

___dateModified.description: Date that the document was last modified
___dateModified.title: Date modified

___format.description: The format of the document taken from the [IANA Media Types code list](http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/), with the addition of one extra value for 'offline/print', used when this document entry is being used to describe the offline publication of a document. Use values from the template column. Links to web pages should be tagged 'text/html'.
___format.title: Format

___description.description: A short description of the document. We recommend descriptions do not exceed 250 words. In the event the document is not accessible online, the description field can be used to describe arrangements for obtaining a copy of the document.
___description.title: Description

___url.description: direct link to the document or attachment. The server providing access to this document should be configured to correctly report the document mime type.
___url.title: URL

___datePublished.description: The date on which the document was first published. This is particularly important for legally important documents such as notices of a tender.
___datePublished.title: Date published

___id.description: A local, unique identifier for this document. This field is used to keep track of multiple revisions of a document through the compilation from release to record mechanism.
___id.title: ID

___documentType.description: A classification of the document described taken from the [documentType codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/codelists/#document-type). Values from the provided codelist should be used wherever possible, though extended values can be provided if the codelist does not have a relevant code.
___documentType.title: Document type

___transactions.description: A list of the spending transactions made against this contract
___transactions.title: Transactions

$eref.description: A spending transaction related to the contracting process. Draws upon the data models of the [Fiscal Data Package](http://fiscal.dataprotocols.org/) and the [International Aid Transpareny Initiative](http://iatistandard.org/activity-standard/iati-activities/iati-activity/transaction/) and should be used to cross-reference to more detailed information held using a Budget Data Package, IATI file, or to provide enough information to allow a user to manually or automatically cross-reference with some other published source of transactional spending data.
$eref.title: Transaction information

___receiverOrganization.description: The Organization Identifier for the organization which receives the funds in this transaction. Expressed following the Organizational Identifier standard - consult the documentation and the codelist.
___receiverOrganization.title: Receiver organization

___uri.description: A URI pointing directly to a machine-readable record about this spending transaction.
___uri.title: Linked spending information

___providerOrganization.description: The Organization Identifier for the organization from which the funds in this transaction originate. Expressed following the Organizational Identifier standard - consult the documentation and the codelist.
___providerOrganization.title: Provider organization

___id.description: A unique identifier for this transaction. This identifier should be possible to cross-reference against the provided data source. For the budget data package this is the id, for IATI, the transaction reference.
___id.title: ID

___source.description: Used to point either to a corresponding Budget Data Package, IATI file, or machine or human-readable source where users can find further information on the budget line item identifiers, or project identifiers, provided here.
___source.title: Data source

___milestones.description: As milestones are completed, milestone completions should be documented.
___milestones.title: Milestones

___documents.description: List of documents associated with this milestone.
___documents.title: Documents

___dateModified.description: The date the milestone was last reviewed or modified and the status was altered or confirmed to still be correct.
___dateModified.title: Date modified

___description.description: A description of the milestone.
___description.title: Description

___status.description: The status that was realized on the date provided in dateModified, drawn from the [milestoneStatus codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/codelists/#milestone-status).
___status.title: Status

___dueDate.description: The date the milestone is due.
___dueDate.title: Due date

___id.description: A local identifier for this milestone, unique within this block. This field is used to keep track of multiple revisions of a milestone through the compilation from release to record mechanism.
___id.title: ID

_88Address.description: An address. This may be the legally registered address of the organization, or may be a correspondence address for this particular contracting process.
_88Address.title: Address

___streetAddress.description: The street address. For example, 1600 Amphitheatre Pkwy.
___streetAddress.title: Street address

___locality.description: The locality. For example, Mountain View.
___locality.title: Locality

___countryName.description: The country name. For example, United States.
___countryName.title: Country name

___language.description: Specifies the default language of the data using either two-digit ISO 639-1, or extended BCP47 language tags. The use of two-letter codes from ISO 639-1 is strongly recommended.
___language.title: Release language

___awards.description: Information from the award phase of the contracting process. There may be more than one award per contracting process e.g. because the contract is split amongst different providers, or because it is a standing offer.
___awards.title: Awards

$eref.description: An award for the given procurement. There may be more than one award per contracting process e.g. because the contract is split amongst different providers, or because it is a standing offer.
$eref.title: Award

___documents.description: All documents and attachments related to the award, including any notices.
___documents.title: Documents

___description.description: Award description
___description.title: Description

___status.description: The current status of the award drawn from the [awardStatus codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/codelists/#award-status)
___status.title: Award status

___suppliers.description: The suppliers awarded this award. If different suppliers have been awarded different items of values, these should be split into separate award blocks.
___suppliers.title: Suppliers

___contractPeriod.description: The period for which the contract has been awarded.
___contractPeriod.title: Contract period

___items.description: The goods and services awarded in this award, broken into line items wherever possible. Items should not be duplicated, but the quantity specified instead.
___items.title: Items awarded

___value.description: The total value of this award. In the case of a framework contract this may be the total estimated lifetime value, or maximum value, of the agreement. There may be more than one award per procurement.
___value.title: Value

___date.description: The date of the contract award. This is usually the date on which a decision to award was made.
___date.title: Award date

___id.description: The identifier for this award. It must be unique and cannot change within the Open Contracting Process it is part of (defined by a single ocid). See the [identifier guidance](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/identifiers/) for further details.
___id.title: Award ID

___ocid.description: A globally unique identifier for this Open Contracting Process. Composed of a publisher prefix and an identifier for the contracting process. For more information see the [Open Contracting Identifier guidance](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/identifiers/)
___ocid.title: Open Contracting ID

___initiationType.description: String specifying the type of initiation process used for this contract, taken from the [initiationType](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/codelists/#initiation-type) codelist. Currently only tender is supported.
___initiationType.title: Initiation type

$eref.description: Data regarding tender process - publicly inviting prospective contractors to submit bids for evaluation and selecting a winner or winners.
$eref.title: Tender

___status.description: The current status of the tender based on the [tenderStatus codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/codelists/#tender-status)
___status.title: Tender status

___submissionMethod.description: Specify the method by which bids must be submitted, in person, written, or electronic auction. Using the [submission method codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/codelists/#submission-method)
___submissionMethod.title: Submission method

___procurementMethod.description: Specify tendering method against the [method codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/codelists/#method) as per [GPA definitions](http://www.wto.org/english/docs_e/legal_e/rev-gpr-94_01_e.htm) of Open, Selective, Limited
___procurementMethod.title: Procurement method

___hasEnquiries.description: A Yes/No field to indicate whether enquiries were part of tender process.
___hasEnquiries.title: Has enquiries?

___tenderers.description: All entities who submit a tender.
___tenderers.title: Tenderers

___awardCriteriaDetails.description: Any detailed or further information on the award or selection criteria.
___awardCriteriaDetails.title: Award criteria details

___awardPeriod.description: The date or period on which an award is anticipated to be made.
___awardPeriod.title: Award period

___minValue.description: The minimum estimated value of the procurement.
___minValue.title: Minimum value

___documents.description: All documents and attachments related to the tender, including any notices. See the [documentType codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/codelists/#document-type) for details of potential documents to include.
___documents.title: Documents

___enquiryPeriod.description: The period during which enquiries may be made and answered.
___enquiryPeriod.title: Enquiry period

___description.description: Tender description
___description.title: Tender description

___procurementMethodDetails.description: Additional detail on the procurement method used. This field may be used to provide the local name of the particular procurement method used.
___procurementMethodDetails.title: Procurement method details

___value.description: The total upper estimated value of the procurement.
___value.title: Value

___awardCriteria.description: Specify the award criteria for the procurement, using the [award criteria codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/codelists/#award-criteria)
___awardCriteria.title: Award criteria

___eligibilityCriteria.description: A description of any eligibility criteria for potential suppliers.
___eligibilityCriteria.title: Eligibility criteria

___milestones.description: A list of milestones associated with the tender.
___milestones.title: Milestones

___procurementMethodRationale.description: Rationale of procurement method, especially in the case of Limited tendering.
___procurementMethodRationale.title: Procurement method rationale

___tenderPeriod.description: The period when the tender is open for submissions. The end date is the closing date for tender submissions.
___tenderPeriod.title: Tender period

___procuringEntity.description: The entity managing the procurement, which may be different from the buyer who is paying / using the items being procured.
___procuringEntity.title: Procuring entity

___items.description: The goods and services to be purchased, broken into line items wherever possible. Items should not be duplicated, but a quantity of 2 specified instead.
___items.title: Items to be procured

___id.description: An identifier for this tender process. This may be the same as the ocid, or may be drawn from an internally held identifier for this tender.
___id.title: Tender ID

___numberOfTenderers.description: The number of entities who submit a tender.
___numberOfTenderers.title: Number of tenderers

___submissionMethodDetails.description: Any detailed or further information on the submission method. This may include the address, e-mail address or online service to which bids should be submitted, and any special requirements to be followed for submissions.
___submissionMethodDetails.title: Submission method details

___tender.description: The activities undertaken in order to enter into a contract.
___tender.title: Tender

___contracts.description: Information from the contract creation phase of the procurement process.
___contracts.title: Contracts

$eref.description: Information regarding the signed contract between the buyer and supplier(s).
$eref.title: Contract

___documents.description: All documents and attachments related to the contract, including any notices.
___documents.title: Documents

___description.description: Contract description
___description.title: Contract description

___status.description: The current status of the contract. Drawn from the [contractStatus codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/codelists/#contract-status)
___status.title: Contract status

___awardID.description: The award.id against which this contract is being issued.
___awardID.title: Award ID

___items.description: The goods, services, and any intangible outcomes in this contract. Note: If the items are the same as the award do not repeat.
___items.title: Items contracted

___period.description: The start and end date for the contract.
___period.title: Period

___dateSigned.description: The date the contract was signed. In the case of multiple signatures, the date of the last signature.
___dateSigned.title: Date signed

___value.description: The total value of this contract.
___value.title: Value

___implementation.description: Information related to the implementation of the contract in accordance with the obligations laid out therein.
___implementation.title: Implementation

___id.description: The identifier for this contract. It must be unique and cannot change within its Open Contracting Process (defined by a single ocid). See the [identifier guidance](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/identifiers/) for further details.
___id.title: Contract ID

___date.description: The date this information is released, it may well be the same as the parent publishedDate, it must not be later than the publishedDate from the parent package. It is used to determine merge order.
___date.title: Release Date

$eref.description: An organization.
$eref.title: Organization

___name.description: The common name of the organization. The ID property provides an space for the formal legal name, and so this may either repeat that value, or could provide the common name by which this organization is known. This field could also include details of the department or sub-unit involved in this contracting process.
___name.title: Common name

___additionalIdentifiers.description: A list of additional / supplemental identifiers for the organization, using the [organization identifier guidance](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/identifiers/). This could be used to provide an internally used identifier for this organization in addition to the primary legal entity identifier.
___additionalIdentifiers.title: Additional identifiers

___identifier.description: The primary identifier for this organization. Identifiers that uniquely pick out a legal entity should be preferred. Consult the [organization identifier guidance](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/identifiers/) for the preferred scheme and identifier to use.
___identifier.title: Primary identifier

___buyer.description: The buyer is the entity whose budget will be used to purchase the goods. This may be different from the procuring agency who may be specified in the tender data.
___buyer.title: Buyer

$eref.description: Information from the planning phase of the contracting process. Note that many other fields may be filled in a planning release, in the appropriate fields in other schema sections, these would likely be estimates at this stage e.g. totalValue in tender
$eref.title: Planning

___documents.description: A list of documents related to the planning process.
___documents.title: Documents

___rationale.description: The rationale for the procurement provided in free text. More detail can be provided in an attached document.
___rationale.title: Rationale

___planning.description: Information from the planning phase of the contracting process. This includes information related to the process of deciding what to contract for, when and how.
___planning.title: Planning

___id.description: A unique identifier that identifies this release. A release ID must be unique within a release-package and must not contain the # character.
___id.title: Release ID

___tag.description: A value from the [releaseTag codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.0/en/schema/codelists/#release-tag) that identifies the nature of the release being made. Tags may be used to filter release, or, in future, for advanced validation when certain kinds of releases should contain certain fields.
___tag.title: Release Tag
